To expand the Timucuan Ecological and Historic Preserve, Florida.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-493.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 280.

action.text: Mr. Radanovich moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3768.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici under authority of the order of the Senate of 07/22/04 without amendment. With written report No. 108-333.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 689.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 10/5/2004--Public Law. Timucuan Ecological and Historic Preserve Boundary Revision Act of 2004 - Modifies the boundaries of the Timucuan Ecological and Historic Preserve to incorporate additional acreage located in Nassau County, Florida. Requires the Secretary of the Interior to revise Preserve boundaries and maintain a map of the additional acreage for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the National Park Service.
